t:intro.p: The ARIMA function calculates the coefficients for a sequence of parameters, producing an ARIMA model that is typically input to the function ARIMAPredict.
For general information about ARIMA models, see https://www.otexts.org/fpp/8.

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM ARIMA ( ON { table | view | (query) } AS InputTable [ ON { table | view } AS OrdersTable ] OUT TABLE ModelTable (model_table) [ OUT TABLE ResidualTable (residual_table) ] USING TimeColumns ({ 'time_column' | time_column_range }[,...]) TargetColumn ('target_column') [ PartitionColumns ('partition_column' [,...]) ] [ Orders ('p, d, q') | OrderP (p) OrderD (d) OrderQ (q) ] [ SeasonalOrders ('sp, sd, sq') | SeasonalOrderP (sp) SeasonalOrderD (sd) SeasonalOrderQ (sq) ] [ Period (period)] [ IncludeMean ({'true'|'t'|'yes'|'y'|'1'|'false'|'f'|'no'|'n'|'0'}) ] [ IncludeDrift ({'true'|'t'|'yes'|'y'|'1'|'false'|'f'|'no'|'n'|'0'}) ] [ MaxIterNum (max_iteration_number) ] [ FitMethod ({ 'SSE' | 'ML' }) ] ) AS alias;

div.dd: Specify the name of the table where the function outputs the coefficients of the input parameters; that is, the model.

[Optional] Specify this syntax element if you intend to input the model to the ARIMAPredict function.
Specify the name of the table where the function outputs the residuals of the input parameters.
Specify the names of the InputTable columns that specify the sequence (time points) of the input parameters. The sequence must have uniform intervals.
Specify the name of the column that contains the time series data in InputTable.
[Optional] Specify the columns by which the InputTable is partitioned.

[Required if you omit OrdersTable, OrderP, OrderD, and OrderQ; disallowed otherwise.] Specify the values of the nonseasonal parameters for the ARIMA model—p, d, and q. p and q must be INTEGER values in the range [0, 10]. d must be the INTEGER 0 or 1.
Note: If you do not specify the values of nonseasonal parameters p, d, and q, the function determines and uses their optimal values.
[Required if you omit OrdersTable and Orders; disallowed otherwise.] Specify the value of the nonseasonal parameter p for the ARIMA model, an INTEGER in the range [0, 10].
[Required if you omit OrdersTable and Orders; disallowed otherwise.] Specify the value of the nonseasonal parameter d for the ARIMA model, the INTEGER 0 or 1.
[Required if you omit OrdersTable and Orders; disallowed otherwise.] Specify the value of the nonseasonal parameter q for the ARIMA model, an INTEGER in the range [0, 10].

[Optional. Disallowed with SeasonalOrderP, SeasonalOrderD, and SeasonalOrderQ.] Specify the values of the seasonal parameters for the ARIMA model—sp, sd, and sq. sp and sq must be INTEGER values in the range [0, 10]. sd must be an INTEGER in the range [0, 3].
Note: If you specify SeasonalOrders, you must also specify Period.
Note: If you do not specify the values of seasonal parameters sp, sd, and sq, the function does not include seasonal variation in its calculations.
[Optional if you omit OrdersTable and SeasonalOrders, disallowed otherwise.] Specify the value of the seasonal parameter sp for the ARIMA model, an INTEGER in the range [0, 10].

dd.p: Note: If you specify SeasonalOrderP, you must also specify SeasonalOrderD, SeasonalOrderQ, and Period.

div.dd:
[Optional if you omit OrdersTable and SeasonalOrders, disallowed otherwise.] Specify the value of the seasonal parameter sd for the ARIMA model, an INTEGER in the range [0, 3].
Note: If you specify SeasonalOrderD, you must also specify SeasonalOrderP, SeasonalOrderQ, and Period.

[Optional if you omit OrdersTable and SeasonalOrders, disallowed otherwise.] Specify the value of the seasonal parameter sq for the ARIMA model, an INTEGER in the range [0, 10].
Note: If you specify SeasonalOrderQ, you must also specify SeasonalOrderP, SeasonalOrderD, and Period.
[Optional] Specify the period of a season (m in the formula). The period must be a positive integer value.

[Optional. Allowed only with either Orders or all of OrderP, OrderD, and OrderQ.] Specify whether the function adds a mean term to the ARIMA model.
Note: If IncludeMean is 'true', d must be 0 in Orders or OrderD and sd must be 0 in SeasonalOrders or SeasonalOrderD.
Default: 'false'

[Optional. Allowed only with either Orders or all of OrderP, OrderD, and OrderQ.] Specify whether the function adds a drift term to the ARIMA model.
Note: If IncludeDrift is 'true', d must be 1 in Orders or OrderD.
Default: 'false'
[Optional] Specify the maximum iteration number for estimating the parameters. This value must be a positive integer.
Default: 10000

[Optional] Specify the method for fitting the model parameters:
Option
Description
'SSE' (Default)
Sum of squared error.
'ML'
Maximum likelihood. This method is more accurate, but slower to calculate.

td.div:
[Optional] Has same schema as TimeSeriesOrders Output table. Contains values of nonseasonal parameters p, d, and q for ARIMA model.
If you omit this table, you must specify either the Orders syntax element or the OrderP, OrderD, and OrderQ syntax elements.

Sequence (time points) of input parameters.
Note: If time points do not have uniform intervals, run the Interpolator function on them before running the ARIMA function on the InputTable. Otherwise, intervals of predictions of the ARIMAPredict function might not be as expected.
SMALLINT, INT, BIGINT, NUMERIC, or DOUBLE PRECISION
[Column appears once for each partition_column specified in PartitionColumns.] Column by which input data is partitioned.
Contains coefficients of model. Function outputs coefficients to both ModelTable and screen.
Contains value and residual for each time point.
[Column appears once for each partition_column specified in PartitionColumns.] Partition identifier.
[Appears only if you omit PartitionColumns.] Random partition identifier value.
Vector of coefficients p, d, q, sp, sd, and sq.
Vector of auto regression parameters that correspond to coefficients.
Vector of moving average parameters that correspond to coefficients.
Vector of seasonal auto regressive parameters that correspond to coefficients.
Vector of seasonal moving average parameters that correspond to coefficients.

Seasonal model: Cycle period.
Nonseasonal model: 0
[Column appears once for each partition_column specified in PartitionColumns.] Partition identifier.
[Appears only if you omit PartitionColumns.] Random partition identifier value.
[Column appears once for each specified time_column.] Sequence (time points) of input parameter.
Same type as target_column in InputTable

t:intro.h3: ARIMA Example: OrdersTable, PartitionColumns, No Seasonality
t:intro.p: The input table, milk_3, is partitioned into two time series.

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM ARIMA ( ON milk_3 AS InputTable ON arimaex1_orders AS OrdersTable OUT TABLE ModelTable (arimaex1_model) OUT TABLE ResidualTable (arimaex1_resid) USING TimeColumns ('period') TargetColumn ('milkpound') PartitionColumns ('id_partition') ) AS dt;

id_partition coef value_col ------------ ------------------ --------------------------------------- 2 coef 0, 1, 2, 0, 0, 0 2 ar_params NULL 2 ma_params 0.8306295578094496 ,0.3998570673162409 2 seasonal_ar_params NULL 2 seasonal_ma_params NULL 2 period 0 2 sigma2 643.230614797225 2 aic 6.50388649193462 2 bic 6.553845909401198 2 iterations 33 2 converged true 1 coef 1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0 1 ar_params 0.34347347277005386 1 ma_params 0.5815242132319824 1 seasonal_ar_params NULL 1 seasonal_ma_params NULL 1 period 0 1 sigma2 591.665550628751 1 aic 6.468047909957085 1 bic 6.546777595136237 1 iterations 33 1 converged true

t:intro.p: Download a zip file of all examples and a SQL script file that creates their input tables from the download tab in the left pane.
t:intro.h3: ARIMA Example: Orders, No PartitionColumns, No Seasonality

ul.li: InputTable: milk_3, as in ARIMA Example: OrdersTable, PartitionColumns, No Seasonality

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM ARIMA ( ON milk_3 AS InputTable OUT TABLE ModelTable (arimaex2_model) OUT TABLE ResidualTable (arimaex2_resid) USING TimeColumns ('period') TargetColumn ('milkpound') Orders ('0,1,2') IncludeDrift ('true') ) AS dt ;

t:intro.p: Download a zip file of all examples and a SQL script file that creates their input tables from the download tab in the left pane.

ul.li: InputTable: milk_3, as in ARIMA Example: OrdersTable, PartitionColumns, No Seasonality

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM ARIMA ( ON milk_3 AS InputTable OUT TABLE ModelTable (arimaex3_model) OUT TABLE ResidualTable (arimaex3_resid) USING TimeColumns ('period') TargetColumn ('milkpound') Orders ('0,1,2') SeasonalOrderP (0) SeasonalOrderD (1) SeasonalOrderQ (1) Period (12) ) AS dt;

t:intro.p: Download a zip file of all examples and a SQL script file that creates their input tables from the download tab in the left pane.
